means: 有斜度( slope的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Sloping walls on the bulk of the building create an optical illusion.
sentence.Network_cn: 大楼主体的斜墙给人造成一种视错觉。

sentence.Network_en: I managed to pull myself up onto a wet, sloping ledge.
sentence.Network_cn: 我终于爬上了一块潮湿倾斜的暗礁。

sentence.Network_en: Each firm will face a downward-sloping demand curve.
sentence.Network_cn: 每一家企业都将面临需求曲线的下滑。

entry.def: A slope is the side of a mountain, hill, or valley.

example.ex: Saint-Christo is perched on a mountain slope.
example.tran: 圣克里斯托教堂坐落在一个山坡上。
喜马拉雅山脉较低处的山坡

entry.def: A slope is a surface that is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.

example.ex: The street must have been on a slope.
example.tran: 这条街一定是建在一个斜坡上。

entry.def: If a surface slopes, it is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.

example.ex: The bank sloped down sharply to the river...
example.tran: 河岸到河面的斜坡非常陡。

entry.def: If something slopes, it leans to the right or to the left rather than being upright.

example.ex: He wonders why the digits on his calculator slope to the right.
example.tran: 他不明白为什么他的计算器上面的数字向右倾斜。

entry.def: The slope of something is the angle at which it slopes.

example.ex: The slope increases as you go up the curve.
example.tran: 上了弯道以后，路越来越陡。
一段坡度为 10° 的斜坡

entry.def: If someone slopes into or out of a place, they enter or leave it quickly and quietly, especially because they are trying to avoid or escape something.

example.ex: She sloped off quietly on Saturday afternoon...
example.tran: 星期六下午，她脚底抹油，溜之大吉。

example.ex: They sloped into their hotel at 6am.
example.tran: 凌晨 6 点，他们悄悄地潜入他们下榻的饭店。

means.word_mean: 1. having an oblique or slanted direction
2. having a slanting form or direction;
